assignment.pkg5

Class Shape3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment.pkg5.Shape3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Shape3D>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cone, Cylinder, Parallelepiped, Sphere

    public abstract class Shape3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Shape3D>
    Shape3D is an abstract SuperClass used as the parent class for the individual shapes - Knows its center's coordinates - Knows its Shape type - Abstract method to calculate volume - Abstract method to calculate Surface Area - Can calculate the center's distance from the origin - Can compare the volumes of different shapes Implements the Comparable class casted to Shape3D objects

      • distanceFromOrigin

        public double distanceFromOrigin()
        distanceFromOrigin is used to calculate the distance of the center of the shape from the origin at (0,0,0)
        Returns:
        The computed distance between the shapes center and the origin will be returned

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString is used to output the coordinates of the center of the shape as a String, by calling the toString method of the Point3D class object This will be overriding the standard toString method
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The coordinates of the center of the shape will be returned as a String

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Shape3D temp)
        CompareTo is used compare which shape comes before/after the other in terms of volume. Since we are using ascending order for this, we will go by those rules. The smaller volumes will be at the front of the array This will be overriding the standard compareTo method of the Comparable class
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Shape3D>
        Parameters:
        temp - - the explicit "second" parameter that we are comparing with
        Returns:
        -1 implicit comes before explicit 0 if they are the same volume 1 implicit comes after explicit
